NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 假定，假设
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Our assumption that we would win was wrong.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 破坏，毁灭
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The enemy bombs caused death and destruction.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. get rid of; discard 摆脱；扔弃
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. A million tonnes of untreated sewage is dumped into the sea.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. make able 使能够
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. This pass enables me to travel half-price on trains.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a sudden, great increase; the act or an instance of exploding 激增；爆炸
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The study also forecast an explosion in the diet soft-drink market.

NewWords.WordPhrase: in spite of 尽管
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. For all its beauty, the city could soon lose some of the individuality that had been preserved over the years.

NewWords.WordPhrase: go away 离开
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. There's a meeting after work, so I won't be able to get away from the office before.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. make or become hard or harder （使）变硬
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Heat will harden this material and make it brittle too.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. make (a palce) untidy by throwing away rubbish carelessly （在…）乱扔废物
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He was fined for littering the park.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. the human race 人类
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We should make our contributions to mankind.

NewWords.WordPhrase: only 仅仅；只有
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Nothing but a miracle can save him.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a small piece, part, or section 小片，小块
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. There was a small patch of blue in the grey clouds.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. 掐（掉），夹；捏，拧
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He pinched the child's cheek playfully.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. make impure or unclean 污染；弄脏
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The rivers were polluted with chemical waste from factories.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. become corroded 被腐蚀；生锈
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The bicycle rusted when it was left out in the rain.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (spoilt or spoiled) vt. cause to become of no use or value; ruin 糟蹋；破坏
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He spoiled the soup by putting too much salt in it.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. discolor, soil, or spot 染污；玷污
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The coffee I spilt has stained my trousers.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 物质
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Soil consists of various chemical substances.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a victory or conquest 胜利；征服
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Winning the battle is his greatest triumph.

NewWords.WordPhrase: bring in or be brought to the shore （将…）冲上岸
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Cargo from the wrecked ship was washed up on the shore.
